result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Metko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety
Shall not enter any bars, liquor stores, or beer tents.
No contact with victim S.A.S.

Participate in any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Random UAs & PBTs.
Sex Offender registry held open.
7 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF478 and 15CF69 called: 1:34pm
State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.

Parties state argument on sentencing recommendation.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS:

14CF478 - Ct. 1 (4th Deg S.A./Repeater)>> 2 years TOTAL; 1 year incarceration and 1 year ES, w/credit for 181 days of time already served.
CONDITIONS of ES>>CC
State requests COURT review sex offender registry -- COURT does not order registry.
Defendant is eligible for SAP but NOT eligible for CIP; COURT directs that JOC reflect that the court strongly recommends substance abuse program while defendant in prison.

15CF69 - Ct. 1 (Misd BJ)>> 6 month MCJ, consecutive, w/credit for 8 days of time already served; CC.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:24 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF478 & 15CF69**
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Suzanne O'Neill. 
Defendant previously entered pleas, however, pleas were then vacated as a result of defendant having a positive PBT at probation check in. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW.
State is not filing any new charges as a result of the incident that occured at the plea/sentencing hearing on 02/09/15. 
State moves to: 14CF478- amend Ct.1 to 4th Degree Sexual Assault (Repeater) 
                           15CF69- amend Ct.1 to Bail Jumping (Misd)
COURT GRANTS.
PLEA: 14CF478- Ct.1- 4th Degree Sexual Assault of a Child (Repeater)>>NO CONTEST 
           15CF69- Ct.1- Bail Jumping- (Misd)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH- probation for 2 years concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: Participate in any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, absolute sobriety, shall not enter any bars, liqour stores or beer tents, random UA's & PBT's, AODA, no contact with victim S.A.S, DNA sample, CC & DNA surcharge. Sex offender registry is held open. 
15CF69- 8 days credit & 14CF478- 7 days credit if revoked. 
Adj: 9:37 a.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 14CF478, filed in 15CF69)
INCLUDES 15CF69, 14CF478.  Absolute sobriety.
Plea hearing on February 13, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 3:35 p.m. 
**Includes 14CF478 & 15CF69**
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Suzanne O'Neill. Defendant in court earlier today for plea/sentencing hearing. COURT questions defendant as to breathalyzer test done in probation and parole and positive result for alcohol. COURT vacates plea of NO CONTEST today. State notes concerns regarding plea hearing dates. Attorney O'Neill makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: $2,000.00 cash bond with condition of Absolute Sobriety. 
Plea Hearing to be set for later this week. 
Adj: 3:39 p.m.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:46 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF478 & 15CF69**
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears with Attorney Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW. 
State moves to: 14CF478 amend Ct.1- 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of a Child to 4th Degree Sexual Assault (Repeater) 940.225(3m) & amend Ct.1 Bail Jumping (Felony) to Bail Jumping (Misd) 
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF478- Ct.1 4th Degree Sexual Assault (Repeater)>>NO CONTEST 
           15CF69- Ct.1 Bail Jumping (Misd)>>NO CONTEST 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH- 2 years probation on both counts concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: Absolute Sobriety, AODA and any follow-up, any counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, random urinalysis and breathalyzers to be used at agent's discretion, if probation is revoked, agent can request sex offender registry on 14CF478 as it is not ordered at this time, no contact with S.A.S., CC & DNA surcharge on both counts and DNA sample on 14CF478. 
Adj: 10:01 a.m.

Shall not consume alcohol.  Absolute sobriety.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  No contact with victim(s) or family (unless incidental at work.  No contact with minors unless supervised by an adult over 25 years of age.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
